subject: RE: [junit] testing XML APIs
msgSnippet: Thanks for your reply Kamal. XML API i meant is ,an actually a method which when called will call a CLI command(this command will be executed in my switch )and
messageBody:
Thanks for your reply Kamal.

XML API i meant is ,an actually a method which when called will call a CLI
command(this command will be executed in my switch )and this API return data
type will a XML.So my test has to test this API.

Thanks and regards,
AmudhaK

NOTE : for eg,if i call a api say,getNames(),this api will internally call a
switch cli command "getnames" and return the names in an XML format.

-----Original Message-----
From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com]On Behalf Of
Kamal Ahmed
Sent: Wednesday, July 05, 2006 9:45 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [junit] testing XML APIs


AmudhaK,
By XML API, you mean XML Documents? Or java code which generates XML.
If you can give us sample code then we would have a better idea of its
testability.

Thanks,
-Kamal

-----Original Message-----
From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
Amudha Karuppannan
Sent: Wednesday, July 05, 2006 9:42 AM
To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: [junit] testing XML APIs


Hello all,

I just want to know whether we can test XML APIs using junit.

Thanks and regards,
AmudhaK
